snippet: Research by a group of accounting professors shows that the revolving door actually toughens enforcement results at the S.E.C. — the opposite of what government critics have maintained.
abstract: Research by a group of accounting professors shows that the revolving door, symbolic portal that executives and lawyers pass through on their way to government posts and back again to the private sector, actually toughens enforcement results at the Securities and Exchange Commission; finding is the opposite of what government critics have maintained
lead_paragraph: Research by a group of accounting professors shows that the revolving door actually toughens enforcement results at the S.E.C. — the opposite of what government critics have maintained.

headline.seo: Study Casts Doubt on How a Revolving Door Hurts the S.E.C.
headline.main: Study Questions Risk of S.E.C. Revolving Door
headline.print_headline: Study Questions Risk Of S.E.C. Revolving Door
